definition: quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap

sentences.english: He kicked at the bound prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他朝那被绑着的囚犯踢了一脚。

sentences.english: They tied him up to a pole and burned him alive in 1415.
sentences.chinese: 1415年胡斯被绑在柱子上活活烧死。

sentences.english: For over a year, Flash had been tied to a tree in front of someone’s house.
sentences.chinese: 一年多来，“闪光”一直被绑在某人屋前的树上。

sentences.english: Tied to a corner of the cellar, such as the ants when Mr Zhang is flustered.
sentences.chinese: 被绑在地窖一角如百蚁闹心的张志强气急败坏。

sentences.english: The criminal would be attached to a cart wheel and his arms and legs stretched out along the spokes.
sentences.chinese: 犯人被绑在车轮上，手脚顺着轮辐伸直。

sentences.english: Easy Hanzi tied in the tent.
JAKE and GRACE are lashed to posts at the front entrance to Hometree.
sentences.chinese: 杰克和格蕾丝被绑在家园树门口的柱子上。

sentences.english: The thief was pinioned to a tree.
Luckily, he was strapped into his pram at the time, which probably saved his life.
sentences.chinese: 侥幸，当时，他被绑在婴儿车上，这可能救了他的命。

sentences.english: She needed restraints on her bed. She had terrible fever and sweats.
sentences.chinese: 她被绑在床上，高烧不退，出汗不止。

sentences.english: ZuoYuKun tied on the carriage, ready to sent to the headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 左玉琨被绑上马车，准备押解到司令部。

sentences.english: Somewhere in that bag is an angry dinosaur and a kidnapped princess.
sentences.chinese: 这包薯片中藏着库巴和被绑的公主。

sentences.english: Joan of Arc was bound to the stake and burnt to death.
sentences.chinese: 圣女贞德被绑在火刑柱上烧死。

sentences.english: The prisoner had relapsed into his taciturnity.
sentences.chinese: 那被绑的人又回复到沉默状态。

sentences.english: Shouye discovers Youqing has been kidnapped too and decided to let both of them go.
sentences.chinese: 守业发现有情也被绑来，将两人送走。

definition: to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to be unable to move a single step
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
